revised_title: Effect of Direct Electric Current on Coleoptile Growth in Barley
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the effect of a direct electric current of very low intensity on the rate of growth of the coleoptile of barley. They found that the current had a significant impact on the growth rate, with the treated plants showing increased growth rates compared to the control plants. The study highlights the importance of carefully controlled conditions and accurately measured currents in understanding plant responses to electric currents.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
